Articles.Content:
As far as I can tell, there is no limit on post length.  Found this out when someone posted an entire log file for a support request in the Contract Configurator thread (this post).  Aside from the fact that it's probably pretty rough on your servers, it was a pretty terrible user experience - it caused the whole page to get really slow.  Worse, when I replied it kept the spoiler'ed log in the quote (although it didn't initially appear to).  So I inadvertently made it even worse, and had to go back and edit the post (which again, was painfully slow).

Instituting a post-length limit would probably be a good thing for all involved.

There are no limit on the other side either, and if there is, it is 4 chars or less.

Edited November 30, 2015 by Gaarst
Missing word

The thing is, if there is an upper limit added, it still needs to be pretty large. Most of the mod release threads have a fairly large OP, since it'll contain part lists, information, and revision histories. If it's a large enough post, the author will often use spoiler tags and the like. But I'd hate to have to start removing information because of a too-strict size limit.

 

I'm not sure where the best balance is.

5 minutes ago, NecroBones said:

 

The thing is, if there is an upper limit added, it still needs to be pretty large. Most of the mod release threads have a fairly large OP, since it'll contain part lists, information, and revision histories. If it's a large enough post, the author will often use spoiler tags and the like. But I'd hate to have to start removing information because of a too-strict size limit.

 

I'm not sure where the best balance is.

 

I'm 95% sure the old forum had a limit, and I never hit it in the Contract Configurator OP (the changelog is ~ 45KB).  So whatever it was set to on the old forum would probably be good enough.
Oh man, if people can post whole log files that's gonna be rough... I second the motion to set it to whatever it was before, or something similar.

Thinking about it, I don't remember seeing a length limit on the older forums.

As long as people don't post their entire logs, and that mods are here for the few that actually do, putting a limit is not worth the trouble.

If I remember correctly, there was a limit of 100,000 characters per post (including text in spoilers and the like). I only know this because the writer of the Kold War fanfic ran into the limit when putting the entire story into his OP.
I appreciate this feedback, very useful. Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be an option to limit the max post length.
